channel.title: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I
channel.description:
Prohibited Uses of HSI. You agree not to use HSI for operation as an Internet service provider, a server site for ftp, telnet, rlogin, e-mail hosting, "Web hosting" or other similar applications, for any business enterprise, or as an end-point on a non-Comcast local area network or wide area network. You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Comcast and its affiliates, suppliers, and agents against all claims and expenses (including reasonable attorney fees) arising out of any breach of this Section including, but not limited to, any claims based on or arising out of any material violation of any applicable law.
http://www.comcast.net/terms/subscriber/ Should I just ignore that or should I just keep on hosting my lil website? (not a private server).

item.title: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Unhandled:

T4_, he’s talking about his internal IP, which you would have realized had you read “190.168…etc”.

Except class C networks are 192.168.

Read full topic

item.title: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.source: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I

item.title: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

T4_, he’s talking about his internal IP, which you would have realized had you read “190.168…etc”.
You can certainly set a static IP on your internal network. Either through your router, or in the server’s network configuration.
The only time your external IP should change is if you reboot your modem or Comcast decides they want to change it.

Also, why the hell is this stickied?

Read full topic
item.source: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I

item.title: Comcast won't let me host from my computer? What if I
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:6, topic:280379”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=370378.msg2799433#msg2799433 date=1243280368]

I doubt they’ll do anything; but, be aware: they are dicks. Most ISPs throttle port 80, so keep that in mind.

Yup, i host on port 8080, any they like changing my I.P address. Not the one everyone sees, but the one I see to portforward apache.
190.168…etc,. I should really just set my ip into a static ip

You can’t just make your external address static; your ISP (their DHCP) must do that.
[/quote]
Oh, alright, so they can just change it every time my router shuts down or my pc… :([/quote]
They can change it any time, period.

Read full topic

[/quote]
